intro: Tolpis prolifera, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open areas, thriving in full sun. It has a rosette of basal leaves and produces numerous flowering stems that rise from the center. Tolpis prolifera is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
